item.title: Social & Film Night
item.dc:creator: Candida Shinn
item.description: Join us in Kumospace (our Social Meeting Space) this evening from 18:00 UTC+1 to meet each other, take part in games and activities, watch movies or listen to music together, and generally take the time to be a bit creative, fun and, of course, social. Some highlights of tonight include (all timings in UTC+1): 18:00...
item.content:encoded:
Join us in Kumospace (our Social Meeting Space) this evening from 18:00 UTC+1 to meet each other, take part in games and activities, watch movies or listen to music together, and generally take the time to be a bit creative, fun and, of course, social.

Some highlights of tonight include (all timings in UTC+1):

18:00 – Meet the Elders: Come along and chat with Declan Kennedy in Meeting Room 1

19:00 – Collaborative Drawing Class: Join us in the Games Room for some wild drawing fun – Permaculture Pictionary!

19:00 – Young People in Permaculture: Join Mandy Merklein of PermaMed and others to discuss this topic in the Youth Club Room – Everybody welcome, not just the young!

All Night: Watch short films in the EUPC Cinema (Kumospace Screen 1) – see more details HERE

All Night: Go to the Spanish, French, German or Portuguese rooms to check in with others speaking your native tongues. No English language allowed!

All Night: Listen to some cracking tunes and have a boogie with friends in the Party Room

All Night: Catch up on the EUPC so far with others in the the EUPC Cinema (Kumospace Screen 2)

item.title: What next with Permaculture
item.dc:creator: Candida Shinn
item.description: After a rich nine days full of inspiring contributions we want to harvest, reflect and again celebrate the diversity of solutions. We will ask the question: what to do next, so we all are clear to set action in our direct surroundings. Speaker Country Topic / Project Andrew Langford UK & Mexico Re-evaluation Counseling to...
item.content:encoded:
After a rich nine days full of inspiring contributions we want to harvest, reflect and again celebrate the diversity of solutions. We will ask the question: what to do next, so we all are clear to set action in our direct surroundings.

Direct Link to Session: https://www.crowdcast.io/e/eupc2021/10

item.title: Healing Landscapes
item.dc:creator: Candida Shinn
item.description: As Global effects of our local and global actions gain volume and impact, large-scale interventions are needed more than ever in order to revert or at least slow down the changes already happening. However, this is only possible when taking on the large number of varied environmental, social, economical, spiritual and cultural factors, all at...
item.content:encoded:
As Global effects of our local and global actions gain volume and impact, large-scale interventions are needed more than ever in order to revert or at least slow down the changes already happening. However, this is only possible when taking on the large number of varied environmental, social, economical, spiritual and cultural factors, all at the same time. The good news is that we now know the solutions and have the intellectual, physical and energetic capacity to put it all into action. Let’s discover how!

Direct Link to Session: https://www.crowdcast.io/e/eupc2021/9

item.title: Farming with nature
item.dc:creator: Candida Shinn
item.description: Conventional agriculture often shows up as monocultures with desert-like open soils. But there are alternatives that protect the soil, build up humus and still feed us all (organic!). Let’s look into new ways of farming together! Speaker Country Project Stefan Schwarzer – Network Germany Stefan Schwarzer – Network Wolfgang Palme Austria City Farm Wien Alexandre...
item.content:encoded:
Conventional agriculture often shows up as monocultures with desert-like open soils. But there are alternatives that protect the soil, build up humus and still feed us all (organic!). Let’s look into new ways of farming together!

Direct Link to Session: https://www.crowdcast.io/e/eupc2021/8

item.title: Youth, future care and the next generation
item.dc:creator: Candida Shinn
item.description: We celebrate and explore together projects that share permaculture with children, youths, educators and parents. We also look at the powerful perspective offered to permaculture and society by including younger generations and future care as part of a catalyst in building regenerative and sustainable culture. Speaker Location Topic / Project Valentina Cifarelli Italy Permaculture and...
item.content:encoded:
We celebrate and explore together projects that share permaculture with children, youths, educators and parents. We also look at the powerful perspective offered to permaculture and society by including younger generations and future care as part of a catalyst in building regenerative and sustainable culture.

Direct Link to Session: https://www.crowdcast.io/e/eupc2021/7

item.title: An economy for people and planet
item.dc:creator: Candida Shinn
item.description: In an economy for people and planet we will look at the big picture of what kind of economy we need and how people are creating it in cities around Europe and the world, and then drill down into what a permaculture style economy looks like at the local level. Speaker Location Topic / Project...
item.content:encoded:
In an economy for people and planet we will look at the big picture of what kind of economy we need and how people are creating it in cities around Europe and the world, and then drill down into what a permaculture style economy looks like at the local level.

Direct Link to Session: https://www.crowdcast.io/e/eupc2021/6

item.title: Resilient Communities
item.dc:creator: Candida Shinn
item.description: In resilient communities we are celebrating how communities across Europe are finding new ways to meet our needs of food, energy, housing and social life. Inspiring examples and speakers will show us that we can meet our needs, reduce our dependence on fossil fuels and support flourishing biodiversity by working together where we live. Speaker...
item.content:encoded:
In resilient communities we are celebrating how communities across Europe are finding new ways to meet our needs of food, energy, housing and social life. Inspiring examples and speakers will show us that we can meet our needs, reduce our dependence on fossil fuels and support flourishing biodiversity by working together where we live.

Direct Link to Session: https://www.crowdcast.io/e/eupc2021/3

item.title: Everyone Gardens!
item.dc:creator: Candida Shinn
item.description: Gardens and gardeners everywhere; from urban balconies and lots, to suburban backyards, we explore how permaculture principles and whole systems thinking bring us abundant, resilient food gardens and forests, while regenerating ecosystems, small and large, that nurture us and our communities. With practical examples from the permaculture gardens of Europe, we connect and celebrate “Everything...
item.content:encoded:
Gardens and gardeners everywhere; from urban balconies and lots, to suburban backyards, we explore how permaculture principles and whole systems thinking bring us abundant, resilient food gardens and forests, while regenerating ecosystems, small and large, that nurture us and our communities. With practical examples from the permaculture gardens of Europe, we connect and celebrate “Everything Gardens”.

Direct Link to Session: https://www.crowdcast.io/e/eupc2021/2

item.title: Celebrating Permaculture – Start!
item.dc:creator: Candida Shinn
item.description: Permaculture is a worldwide network of practitioners, teachers and experts. Over 40 year this action research field has been growing and we now want to celebrate this amazing toolkit full of strategies that have been invented, tried out and passed on. Speaker Location Topic / Project Declan Kennedy Germany Permaculture is a dance with nature...
item.content:encoded:
Permaculture is a worldwide network of practitioners, teachers and experts. Over 40 year this action research field has been growing and we now want to celebrate this amazing toolkit full of strategies that have been invented, tried out and passed on.

Speaker

Location

Topic / Project

Declan Kennedy

Germany

Permaculture is a dance with nature where nature leads

Eunice Nieves

Portugal

Celebrating the global permaculture community – learning from the pioneers

Martin Kirchner

Austria

Pioneers of Change

Patricia Pereira

Portugal

New Discoveries Project

Valerie Seitz

Austria

Shared vision, joint efforts & collaborative projects

Pavlo Ardanov

Ukraine

Visegrad & Beyond Permaculture Partnership

Andy Goldring

Uk

Permaculture Ethics

Direct Link to Session: https://www.crowdcast.io/e/eupc2021

item.title: Let’s look after each other
item.dc:creator: Candida Shinn
item.description: Looking after each other and ourselves is vital. Our inspiring speakers will take us on short journeys to experience the methods they are using, and will help us explore the challenges and opportunities for looking after each other, to meet our social, physical and inner needs, to prepare ourselves for potentially significant disruptions and build...
item.content:encoded:
Looking after each other and ourselves is vital. Our inspiring speakers will take us on short journeys to experience the methods they are using, and will help us explore the challenges and opportunities for looking after each other, to meet our social, physical and inner needs, to prepare ourselves for potentially significant disruptions and build resilience in ourselves and each other.

Direct Link to Session: https://www.crowdcast.io/e/eupc2021/4
